question: How do I enable a systemd service to start automatically at boot?

golden_answer.summary: Use 'systemctl enable <service>' to create symlinks that start the service at boot, optionally start it immediately with 'systemctl start'.
steps: Check if service exists: systemctl list-unit-files | grep <service-name>
Enable service for automatic start: sudo systemctl enable <service-name>
Start service immediately (optional): sudo systemctl start <service-name>
Verify service is enabled: systemctl is-enabled <service-name>
Verify it starts after reboot: sudo systemctl reboot (then check status)
warnings: Enabling a service doesn't start it immediately - use 'systemctl start' for that
Some services require configuration before enabling (check service documentation)
Use 'systemctl enable --now <service>' to both enable and start in one command
